story_title: New York's Climate Chronicles: 2012-2015 Weather Insights
story_subtitle: Exploring Precipitation Peaks, Temperature Trends, and Windy Days in New York from 2012 to 2015

story_pieces.narration: New York experienced its highest daily precipitation of 118.9 mm on April 30, 2014, highlighting the city's capacity for intense rainfall.
The warmest day recorded was July 18, 2013, with a maximum temperature of 37.8°C, showcasing a notable peak in summer heat.
The coldest day occurred on January 4, 2014, with a minimum temperature of -16.0°C, reflecting a rare dip into freezing conditions.
Snow days varied across the years: 25 in 2012, 5 in 2013, 19 in 2014, and 20 in 2015, illustrating year-to-year variability in winter weather.
The average wind speed across the period was 4.91 km/h, with the windiest day reaching 12.6 km/h on March 13, 2014.
2012 remained the rainiest year with 1146.4 mm of total precipitation, emphasizing its exceptionally wet conditions compared to subsequent years.
